str2: Where, whither, in what place. From hos and pou; what(-ever) where, i.e. At whichever spot.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A gnawing worm; gnawing anguish. Of uncertain derivation; a grub, maggot or earth-worm.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To end, finish, die, complete. From a presumed derivative of teleo; to finish life, i.e. Expire.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Fire; the heat of the sun, lightning; fig: strife, trials; the eternal fire. A primary word; 'fire'.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I extinguish, quench, (b) I suppress, thwart. A prolonged form of an apparently primary verb; to extinguish.
